channel.title: My Private History Audio Feed
channel.description: My personal collection of history audio files.
channel.itunes:author: JDH

item.title: 111 British History - Late Tudor Settlement (1547 to 1603)
item.description: Religious identity violently oscillates under Edward and Mary, culminating in Elizabeth I's settlement, securing Protestant England against Catholic threats and ushering in a golden age.
item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 110 British History - Tudor State and Reformations (1485 to 1547)
item.description: Henry VII secures the Tudor dynasty before Henry VIII's quest for an heir ruptures the Church, establishing royal supremacy and fundamentally reforming the English state.
item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 109 British History - Recovery, War and Change (1350 to 1485)
item.description: Late medieval England was reshaped by demographic recovery, social unrest, the Hundred Years' War, and the dynastic struggles culminating in the rise of the Tudors.
item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 108 British History - From Magna Carta to Black Death (1215 to 1350)
item.description: England's political order evolved through baronial conflict, legal reform, expanding Parliament, and the shattering demographic and economic impact of the Black Death.
item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 107 British History - Angevin Empire and Early Common Law (1154 to 1215)
item.description: The Angevin era fused continental empire-building with legal innovation, producing centralized royal justice and culminating in the constitutional crisis that yielded Magna Carta.
item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 106 British History - Norman Conquest and Settlement (1066 to 1154)
item.description: The Norman Conquest reshaped England through military domination, feudal restructuring, castle building, and sweeping administrative and ecclesiastical transformation.
item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 33 European History - The Thirty Years' War (1618 to 1648)
item.description: Religious and dynastic rivalries ignited the Thirty Years' War, devastating Central Europe and forging modern state sovereignty.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/33_European History The Thirty Years War 1618 to 1648 20251118-183416+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 32 European History - Empires and Rivalries: Habsburgs, Valois, and the Age of Religious Wars (1500 to 1650)
item.description: Habsburg and Valois dynastic rivalries ignited an age of religious wars, shattering old orders and forging a new European system.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/32_European History Empires and Rivalries Habsburgs Valois and the Age of Religious Wars 1500 to 1650 20251118-194304+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 31 European History - Northern Renaissance and Reformations (1450 to 1600)
item.description: The Northern Renaissance and Reformations irrevocably altered Europe's spiritual and political landscape, ushering in centuries of conflict and new states.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/31_European History Northern Renaissance and Reformations 1450 to 1600 20251118-182908+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 30 European History - The Italian Renaissance (1350 to 1550)
item.description: Amidst political turmoil and foreign wars, the Italian Renaissance ignited a cultural rebirth, redefining art, thought, and human potential.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/30_European History The Italian Renaissance 1350 to 1550 20251121-171843+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 29 European History - Late Medieval Crisis and Renewal, 1250 to 1450
item.description: Europe between 1250 and 1450 was reshaped by famine, plague, war, and religious fracture, yet these traumas forged the conditions for political consolidation and early modern renewal.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/29_European History Late Medieval Crisis and Renewal 1250 to 1450 20251112-195048+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 28 European History - The Rise of Medieval Europe's Cities and Trade, 1000 to 1350
item.description: Medieval Europe from 1000 to 1350 was transformed by urban growth, expanding trade networks, and new commercial institutions that redefined economic and social life.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/28_European History The Rise of Medieval Europe s Cities and Trade 1000 to 1350 20251112-194627+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 27 European History - The Crusades (1095 to 1291)
item.description: The Crusades unfolded as a collision of sanctified warfare, shifting power in the Islamic world, and evolving European ambitions that remade both regions.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/27_European History The Crusades 1095 to 1291 20251112-194105+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 26 European History - High Medieval Christendom, 800 to 1250: Church, Empire, and Feudal Order
item.description: Christendom between 800 and 1250 was forged through imperial collapse, feudal realignment, church reform, and the rise of monarchies that anchored a new European order.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/26_European History High Medieval Christendom 800 to 1250 Church Empire and Feudal Order 20251113-151357+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 126 American Hemisphere - Pre-Columbian Americas (circa 1500 BCE to 1500 CE)
item.description: Pre-Columbian America was shaped by Ice Age migrations, independent agricultural revolutions, and the rise of diverse civilizations from the Andes to Mesoamerica.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/126_American Hemisphere Pre-Columbian Americas circa 1500 BCE to 1500 CE 20251118-142211+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 25 European History - The Viking Age, 750 to 1050: Expansion, Trade, and Transformation
item.description: The Vikings arise from nowhere to shape medieval Europe through expansion, trade, violent raiding and political ambition.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/25_European History The Viking Age 750 to 1050 Expansion Trade and Transformation 20251113-150519+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 24 European History - Carolingians and the Frankish Realm, 750 to 987
item.description: The Carolingians rise from Frankish mayors to emperors, then fractured their realm, fundamentally shaping medieval Europe.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/24_European History Carolingians and the Frankish Realm 750 to 987 20251113-145522+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 20 Late Antiquity History - The Post-Roman Kingdoms, 500 to 800 CE
item.description: Western Europe between 500 and 800 transformed from imperial ruin into a patchwork of Germanic kingdoms, where Roman traditions, Christian authority, and new political powers forged the foundations of medieval society.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/20_Late Antiquity History The Post-Roman Kingdoms 500 to 800 CE 20251111-231437+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 123 British History - The British Empire (1801 to 1918)
item.description: Britain forged global dominance from 1801 to 1918, reaching its peak amidst rising nationalism and World War I's devastating costs.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/123_British History The British Empire 1801 to 1918 20251113-143931+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 121 British History - High Victorian Britain (1850 to 1900)
item.description: High Victorian Britain saw unprecedented global power, yet wrestled with profound internal contradictions and emerging challenges to its supremacy.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/121_British History High Victorian Britain 1850 to 1900 20251115-101759+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 122 British History - Edwardian Britain and WWI (1900 to 1918)
item.description: Beneath its golden age facade, Edwardian Britain grappled with profound changes, culminating in the immense upheaval of the First World War.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/122_British History Edwardian Britain and WWI 1900 to 1918 20251112-135023+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 120 British History - Reform, Victorian Society and Empire (1815 to 1850)
item.description: Britain between 1815 and 1850 was forged by political reform, industrial growth, and social upheaval, all within a burgeoning empire.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/120_British History Reform Victorian Society and Empire 1815 to 1850 20251113-133231+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 119 British History - The British Empire (1600 to 1800)
item.description: Explore how the British Empire rose from an obscure island nation to global power through relentless conflict, trade, and slavery.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/119_British History The British Empire 1600 to 1800 20251111-152129+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 118 British History - Industrial Takeoff and War with France (1760 to 1815)
item.description: Britain undergoes rapid industrial transformation and urban change while simultaneously engaging in a decades-long struggle for survival against Revolutionary France.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/118_British History Industrial Takeoff War with France 1760 to 1815 20251110-122330+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 117 British History - Hanoverians, Enlightenment & Empire (1714 to 1760)
item.description: The new Hanoverian dynasty secures Britain's throne, developing cabinet government and driving the nation's political and commercial expansion through the Enlightenment.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/117_British History Hanoverians Enlightenment Empire 1714 to 1760 20251110-122013+0801.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 115 British History - Scotland 1000 to 1707 Kingdom Reformation and Union Debates
item.description: Tracing Scotland's struggle for nationhood against English pressure, the Reformation's religious shift, and the contentious parliamentary union that dissolved the kingdom in 1707.
item.guid: 115 British History Scotland 1000 to 1707 Kingdom Reformation and Union Debates 20251110-121443+0800.mp3

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/115 British History Scotland 1000 to 1707 Kingdom Reformation and Union Debates 20251110-121443+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 112 British History - Early Stuarts and Multiple Kingdoms (1603 to 1640)
item.description: The new Stuart dynasty of King James I and his son Charles play power games with Parliament amid ongoing sectarian tensions.
item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 114 British History - Restoration, Glorious Revolution and Stability (1660 to 1714)
item.description: The monarchy's Restoration yields to a "Glorious Revolution" that permanently limits royal power, establishing parliamentary supremacy and forging a new, financially stable British state.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/114_British History Restoration Glorious Revolution and Stability 1660 to 1714 20251110-120912+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name

item.title: 113 British History - Civil Wars, Commonwealth and Protectorate (1640 to 1660)
item.description: The fatal collision between Charles I's divine right and parliamentary authority sparks civil war, leading to regicide, a republic, and the eventual military rule of Cromwell.

enclosure.url: https://house-dj.github.io/Private-Podcasts/113_British History Civil Wars Commonwealth Protectorate 1640 to 1660 20251110-120614+0800.mp3

item.itunes:author: My Name
